entry.title: Drawing Hilbert Curve using L-system
entry.content:
Reference: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hilbert_curve

To compile the program below : 

clang++ -o hilbert_curve hilbert_curve.cpp -lglfw -framework Cocoa -framework OpenGL -framework IOKit -framework CoreVideo

  1 //
  2 // Author: NagaChaitanya Vellanki
  3 //
  4 #include <GLFW/glfw3.h>
  5 #include <iostream>
  6 #include <string>
  7 
  8 static float LINE_LENGTH = 10.0f;
  9 
 10 static void key_callback(GLFWwindow* window, int key, int scancode, int action, int mods)
 11 {
 12   if (key == GLFW_KEY_ESCAPE && action == GLFW_PRESS) {
 13     glfwSetWindowShouldClose(window, GL_TRUE);
 14   }
 15 }
 16 
 17 // Alphabet : A, B
 18 // Constants : F + -
 19 // Axiom : A
 20 // Production rules:
 21 // A → - B F + A F A + F B -
 22 // B → + A F - B F B - F A +
 23 // - turn left by 90 degrees
 24 // + turn right by 90 degrees
 25 std::string hilbertCurveLSystemRepresentation() {
 26   std::string current("FA");
 27   int generation = 0;
 28 
 29   while(generation < 7) {
 30     std::string next;
 31     for(std::string::iterator it = current.begin(); it != current.end(); it++) {
 32       switch(*it) {
 33         case 'A':
 34           next.append("-BF+AFA+FB-");
 35           break;
 36         case 'B':
 37           next.append("+AF-BFB-FA+");
 38           break;
 39         case '-':
 40           next.append("-");
 41           break;
 42         case '+':
 43           next.append("+");
 44           break;
 45         case 'F':
 46           next.append("F");
 47           break;
 48       };
 49     }
 50 
 51     current = next;
 52     generation++;
 53     //std::cout << "Generation: " <<  " " << current << std::endl;
 54   }
 55 
 56   return current;
 57 }
 58 
 59 void drawHilbertCurve(float x, float y, std::string lrep) {
 60   glClear(GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT);
 61   glPushMatrix();
 62   for(std::string::iterator it = lrep.begin(); it != lrep.end(); it++) {
 63     if(*it == 'F') {
 64       glColor4f(0.5f, 1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
 65       glLineWidth(4.0f);
 66       glBegin(GL_LINES);
 67       glVertex2f(x, y);
 68       x = x + LINE_LENGTH;
 69       glVertex2f(x, y);
 70       glEnd();
 71     }
 72     if(*it == '-' || *it == '+') {
 73       glTranslatef(x, y, 0.0f);
 74       x = 0.0f;
 75       y = 0.0f;
 76       float angle = ((*it == '-') ? 90.0f : -90.0f);
 77       glRotatef(angle, 0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
 78     }
 79   }
 80   glPopMatrix();
 81 }
 82 
 83 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
 84   GLFWwindow* window;
 85 
 86   if(!glfwInit()) {
 87     return -1;
 88   }
 89 
 90   GLFWmonitor* monitor  = glfwGetPrimaryMonitor();
 91   const GLFWvidmode* vidmode = glfwGetVideoMode(monitor);
 92 
 93   window = glfwCreateWindow(vidmode->width, vidmode->height, "Hilbert Curve", monitor, NULL);
 94   if(!window) {
 95     glfwTerminate();
 96     return -1;
 97   }
 98 
 99   glfwSetKeyCallback(window, key_callback);
100   glfwMakeContextCurrent(window);
101 
102   int width, height;
103   glfwGetFramebufferSize(window, &width, &height);
104   float x;
105   float y;
106 
107   glViewport(0, 0, width, height);
108   glMatrixMode(GL_PROJECTION);
109   glLoadIdentity();
110   glOrtho(0.0f, width, 0.0f, height, 0.0, 1.0f);
111   glMatrixMode(GL_MODELVIEW);
112   glLoadIdentity();
113 
114   std::string lrep = hilbertCurveLSystemRepresentation();
115   while(!glfwWindowShouldClose(window)) {
116     drawHilbertCurve(width / 4, 20.0f, lrep);
117     glfwSwapBuffers(window);
118     glfwPollEvents();
119   }
120 
121   glfwTerminate();
122   return 0;
123 }

 20 //angle: 120°
 21 // initial string F

 24 // - turn left by 90 degrees
 25 // + turn right by 90 degrees

 64   std::string current = "FX+FX+";
 65

 67     std::string next;
 68     for(std::string::iterator it = current.begin(); it != current.end(); it++) {
 69       switch(*it) {
 70         case 'X':
 71         next.append("X+YF");

102 // Y ↦ −FX−Y.
103 // - turn left by 90 degrees
104 // + turn right by 90 degrees
105 std::string heighwayDragonLSystemRepresentation() {

107   std::string current = "FX";
108 
109   while(generation < 21) {
110     std::string next;
111     for(std::string::iterator it = current.begin(); it != current.end(); it++) {
112       switch(*it) {

139 void drawDragon(int type, float x, float y) {
140   std::string lrep;
141   float angle;
142 
143   switch(type) {
144     case 0:
145     lrep = heighwayDragonLSystemRepresentation();
146     angle = 90.0f;
147     break;
148     case 1:
149     lrep = twinDragonLSystemRepresentation();
150     angle = 90.0f;
151     break;
152     case 2:
153     lrep = terDragonLSystemRepresentation();
154     angle = 120.0f;
155     break;
156   };
157 
158 
159   glClear(GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT);
160   glPushMatrix();
161   for(std::string::iterator it = lrep.begin(); it != lrep.end(); it++) {
162     if(*it == 'F') {
163       glColor4f(0.5f, 1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f);

165       glBegin(GL_LINES);

168       glVertex2f(x, y);
169       glEnd();
170     }
171     if(*it == '-' || *it == '+') {
172       glTranslatef(x, y, 0.0f);
173       x = 0.0f;
174       y = 0.0f;
175       int sign = ((*it == '-') ? 1 : -1);
176       glRotatef(sign * angle, 0.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f);
177     }
178   }
179   glPopMatrix();
180 }
181

183   GLFWwindow* window;
184

186     return -1;
187   }

190   const GLFWvidmode* vidmode = glfwGetVideoMode(monitor);
191 
192   window = glfwCreateWindow(vidmode->width, vidmode->height, "Sierpinski Triangle", monitor, NULL);

206   glLoadIdentity();
207   glOrtho(0.0f, width, 0.0f, height, 0.0, 1.0f);
208   glMatrixMode(GL_MODELVIEW);
209   glLoadIdentity();
210 
211   long int count = 0;
212   while(!glfwWindowShouldClose(window)) {
213     if(count > 100) {
214       count = 0;
215     }
216 
217     switch(++count % 3) {

219       drawDragon(0, width / 2, height / 2);

221       case 1:

Reference: Chapter-04 of CUDA by Example: An Introduction to General-Purpose GPU Programming 1st Author: Jason Sanders, Edward Kandrot Pages: 312 Publisher: Addison-Wesley Professional ©2010 ISBN: 0131387685 9780131387683

To compile the program below : 

nvcc mandelbrot_set.cu -lglfw -Xlinker -framework,Cocoa,-framework,OpenGL,-framework,IOKit,-framework,CoreVideo

  1 /* Author: NagaChaitanya Vellanki */
  2 
  3 #include <GLFW/glfw3.h>
  4 #include <stdio.h>
  5 #include <stdlib.h>
  6 
  7 #define DIM 2000
  8 
  9 struct cuComplex {
 10   float r;
 11   float i;
 12 
 13   __device__ cuComplex(float a, float b) : r(a), i(b) {
 14   }
 15 
 16   __device__ float magnitude2(void) {
 17     return r * r + i * i;
 18   }
 19 
 20   __device__ cuComplex operator*(const cuComplex& a) {
 21     return cuComplex(r * a.r - i * a.i, i * a.r  + r * a.i);
 22   }
 23 
 24   __device__ cuComplex operator+(const cuComplex& a) {
 25     return cuComplex(r + a.r, i + a.i);
 26   }
 27 };
 28 
 29 __device__ int mandelbrot(int x, int y) {
 30   const float scale = 1.5;
 31   int dim_2 = DIM / 2;
 32   float jx = scale * (float) (dim_2  - x) / dim_2;
 33   float jy = scale * (float) (dim_2  - y) / dim_2;
 34 
 35   cuComplex c(jx, jy);
 36   cuComplex a(0.0, 0.0);
 37 
 38   for(int i = 0; i < 200; i++) {
 39     a = a * a + c;
 40     if (a.magnitude2() > 4) {
 41       return 0;
 42     }
 43   }
 44   return 1;
 45 }
 46 
 47 __global__ void kernel(unsigned char *ptr) {
 48   int x = blockIdx.x;
 49   int y = blockIdx.y;
 50   int offset = x + y * gridDim.x;
 51   int mandelbrotvalue = mandelbrot(x, y);
 52   if(mandelbrotvalue == 1) {
 53     ptr[offset * 4 + 0] = 0;
 54     ptr[offset * 4 + 1] = 0 ;
 55     ptr[offset * 4 + 2] = 0;
 56     ptr[offset * 4 + 3] = 255;
 57   } else {
 58     ptr[offset * 4 + 0] = 255;
 59     ptr[offset * 4 + 1] = 153;
 60     ptr[offset * 4 + 2] = 51;
 61     ptr[offset * 4 + 3] = 255;
 62   }
 63 
 64 }
 65 
 66 struct CPUBitmap {
 67   unsigned char    *pixels;
 68   int     x, y;
 69   void    *dataBlock;
 70 
 71   CPUBitmap( int width, int height, void *d = NULL  ) {
 72     pixels = new unsigned char[width * height * 4];
 73     x = width;
 74     y = height;
 75     dataBlock = d;
 76   }
 77 
 78   ~CPUBitmap() {
 79     delete [] pixels;
 80   }
 81 
 82   unsigned char* get_ptr( void  ) const   { return pixels;  }
 83   long image_size( void  ) const { return x * y * 4;  }
 84 
 85   void display_and_exit() {
 86     CPUBitmap**   bitmap = get_bitmap_ptr();
 87     *bitmap = this;
 88     GLFWwindow* window;
 89 
 90     if(!glfwInit()) {
 91       printf("Failed on GLFW init\n");
 92       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
 93     }
 94 
 95     window = glfwCreateWindow(x, y, "Mandelbrot Set", NULL, NULL);
 96     if(!window) {
 97       glfwTerminate();
 98       printf("Failed to create window\n");
 99       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
100     }
101 
102     glfwMakeContextCurrent(window);
103     glfwSetKeyCallback(window, key_callback);
104 
105     while(!glfwWindowShouldClose(window)) {
106       CPUBitmap*   bitmap =  *(get_bitmap_ptr());
107       glClearColor( 0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0  );
108       glClear( GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT );
109       glDrawPixels(bitmap->x, bitmap->y, GL_RGBA, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, bitmap->pixels);
110       glfwSwapBuffers(window);
111       glfwPollEvents();
112     }
113     glfwTerminate();
114   }
115 
116   // static method used for glut callbacks
117   static CPUBitmap** get_bitmap_ptr( void  ) {
118     static CPUBitmap   *gBitmap;
119     return &gBitmap;
120   }
121 
122   static void key_callback(GLFWwindow* window, int key, int scancode, int action, int mods)
123   {
124     if (key == GLFW_KEY_ESCAPE && action == GLFW_PRESS){
125       glfwSetWindowShouldClose(window, GL_TRUE);
126       glfwTerminate();
127       exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
128     }
129   }
130 };
131 
132 void handleError(cudaError_t error, int lineNo) {
133   if(error != cudaSuccess) {
134     printf("Error: %s\n in file %s at line no %d\n",
135     cudaGetErrorString(error), __FILE__, __LINE__);
136     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
137   }
138 }
139 
140 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) {
141   CPUBitmap bitmap(DIM, DIM);
142   unsigned char *dev_bitmap;
143   handleError(cudaMalloc((void **) &dev_bitmap, bitmap.image_size()), __LINE__);
144   dim3 grid(DIM, DIM);
145   kernel<<<grid,1>>>(dev_bitmap);
146   handleError(cudaMemcpy(bitmap.get_ptr(), dev_bitmap,bitmap.image_size(), cudaMemcpyDeviceToHost), __LINE__);
147   bitmap.display_and_exit();
148   handleError(cudaFree(dev_bitmap), __LINE__);
149   return 0;
150 }

entry.content:
I was wondering how to run OpenGL programs on Mac OSX mavericks. I have previously run programs on Windows using Visual Studio, so i knew that glut needs to be installed on the system. But a google search revealed that they are already installed on the Mac OSX. Here is the standard location for these frameworks.

/System/Library/Frameworks » ls GLUT.framework OpenGL.framework
GLUT.framework:
GLUT       Headers    Resources  Versions   module.map

OpenGL.framework:
Headers    Libraries  OpenGL     Resources  Versions   module.map

These can linked with your program using the –framework option

cc -o hello_gl hello_gl.c -framework,OpenGL,-framework,GLUT

You can also use the GLFW library for creating windows, keyboard and mouse events with OpenGL. Download the GLFW zip files from here

Here is a example OpenGL program from here

#include <GLFW/glfw3.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <stdio.h>
static void error_callback(int error, const char* description)
{
    fputs(description, stderr);
}
static void key_callback(GLFWwindow* window, int key, int scancode, int action, int mods)
{
    if (key == GLFW_KEY_ESCAPE && action == GLFW_PRESS)
        glfwSetWindowShouldClose(window, GL_TRUE);
}
int main(void)
{
    GLFWwindow* window;
    glfwSetErrorCallback(error_callback);
    if (!glfwInit())
        exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
    window = glfwCreateWindow(640, 480, "Simple example", NULL, NULL);
    if (!window)
    {
        glfwTerminate();
        exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
    }
    glfwMakeContextCurrent(window);
    glfwSetKeyCallback(window, key_callback);
    while (!glfwWindowShouldClose(window))
    {
        float ratio;
        int width, height;
        glfwGetFramebufferSize(window, &width, &height);
        ratio = width / (float) height;
        glViewport(0, 0, width, height);
        glClear(GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT);
        glMatrixMode(GL_PROJECTION);
        glLoadIdentity();
        glOrtho(-ratio, ratio, -1.f, 1.f, 1.f, -1.f);
        glMatrixMode(GL_MODELVIEW);
        glLoadIdentity();
        glRotatef((float) glfwGetTime() * 50.f, 0.f, 0.f, 1.f);
        glBegin(GL_TRIANGLES);
        glColor3f(1.f, 0.f, 0.f);
        glVertex3f(-0.6f, -0.4f, 0.f);
        glColor3f(0.f, 1.f, 0.f);
        glVertex3f(0.6f, -0.4f, 0.f);
        glColor3f(0.f, 0.f, 1.f);
        glVertex3f(0.f, 0.6f, 0.f);
        glEnd();
        glfwSwapBuffers(window);
        glfwPollEvents();
    }
    glfwDestroyWindow(window);
    glfwTerminate();
    exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
}

To compile, run the above program (assuming it is saved in a hello_gl.c)

~/Documents/projects/opengl(branch:master*) » cc -o hello_gl hello_gl.c /usr/local/lib/libglfw3.a -framework Cocoa -framework OpenGL -framework IOKit -framework CoreVideo

~/Documents/projects/opengl(branch:master*) » ./hello_gl

Here is a screenshot of the program window


Hey, in case you want to use OpenGL, GLUT with your CUDA program. Here is how you compile your cuda program

nvcc julia_gpu.cu -Xlinker -framework,OpenGL,-framework,GLUT

Tip: To turn on dynlib use this option before running cmake

cmake -D BUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON ./

Happy Hacking!!!!

entry.title: SecureRandom ruby
entry.content:
SecureRandom module in Ruby can be used to generate random data (bytes, numbers, strings). It uses OpenSSL internally (see source code for more details).

irb(main):001:0> require 'securerandom'
=> true
irb(main):002:0> SecureRandom.class
=> Module

Random numbers:

To generate random integers less than n (n > 0)

irb(main):004:0> 10.times{p SecureRandom.random_number(100)}
  43
  85
  60
  38
  39
  11
  25
  50
  33
  17
  => 10

To generate random floating point numbers (specify n <= 0)

irb(main):007:0> 10.times{p SecureRandom.random_number(0)}
  0.4078857773248713
  0.4438855743681517
  0.22977523972328207
  0.3413509270611511
  0.4174679667072889
  0.08786033731795606
  0.8478556241028843
  0.7389558407058121
  0.8063676912935767
  0.6985829466830608
  => 10

Random bytes:

To generate random n bytes

irb(main):008:0> SecureRandom.random_bytes(15)
  => "\eT\xCC\x97\xA5\x18\xFF\xEA\x9BT\xB3\xA7\xB0\x0F\x85"

for hex bytes

irb(main):011:0> SecureRandom.hex(20)
  => "88adbb214a8364c3ebf81e2203c7218ee3aaf59e"

for base64 encoded bytes

irb(main):014:0> SecureRandom.base64(20)
  => "gPHf3U0npHmSXJTT+Xz/rn0C8Xg="

for url safe base64 encoded bytes

irb(main):018:0> SecureRandom.urlsafe_base64(20)
  => "a9xtB405QiSlIDNiX9AhSz4jYq8"

This module can also be used for generating uuids similar to uuidgen

~ » uuidgen
  0589FE3D-E65D-40F2-A3E3-301A5EF624E4

Note: the uuid generated by this module is completely random and is not made up of MAC address as per the docs

irb(main):002:0> SecureRandom.uuid
  => "bf172c47-003e-4bad-b86d-0baffad78d6c"

SecureRandom ruby was originally published by NagaChaitanya Vellanki at Code Musings on May 29, 2014.
